```{r}
library(readxl)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

file_path <- "C:\\Users\\Srishti\\Desktop\\FALL24\\BF\\Typical_Employee_Survey_Data.xlsx"
data <- read_excel(file_path)
head(data)

# Adding Headers to all the columns in the Data File
colnames(data) <- c("A", "B", "C","D","E","F","G","H","I","J","K")
print(data)


# 5 point Summary and Boxplot
summary(data)

for (i in 1:ncol(data)) {
  boxplot(data[[i]], main = paste("Boxplot of Column", colnames(data[i])), ylab = names(data)[i])
}

# Converting some columns to factors
data$B <- as.factor(data$B)
data$C <- as.factor(data$C)
data$D <- as.factor(data$D)
data$F <- as.factor(data$D)
data$G <- as.factor(data$G)
data$H <- as.factor(data$H)
data$I <- as.factor(data$I)
data$J <- as.factor(data$J)
data$K <- as.factor(data$K)
print(data)


# Plotting suitable plots based on column type
#Plotting Histogram for continuous data

ggplot(data, aes(x = A)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 5, fill = "yellow", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Histogram - Column A")
 
ggplot(data, aes(x = E)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 5, fill = "yellow", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Histogram - Column E")
 
# Plotting Bar Plot for Factor data

ggplot(data, aes(x = B)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column B")

ggplot(data, aes(x = C)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column C")

ggplot(data, aes(x = D)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column D")
 
ggplot(data, aes(x = F)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column F")
 
ggplot(data, aes(x = G)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column G")
 
ggplot(data, aes(x = H)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column H")

ggplot(data, aes(x = I)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column I")
 
ggplot(data, aes(x = K)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column K")

ggplot(data, aes(x = J)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "orange", color = "black") +
  ggtitle("Bar Plot for Column J")


# Showing a few relationships between columns

ggplot(data, aes(x = A, y = B)) +
  geom_point(color = "blue") +
  ggtitle("Scatter Plot for Column A vs Column B") +
  xlab("Column A") +
  ylab("Column B")

ggplot(data, aes(x = A, y = C)) +
  geom_point(color = "blue") +
  ggtitle("Scatter Plot for Column A vs Column C") +
  xlab("Column A") +
  ylab("Column C")

```
